FuncDef:
The policy command configures an NQA LSP ping test instance.
The undo policy command deletes an NQA LSP ping test instance.
By default, no NQA LSP test instance is configured.
CLIs: undo policy { policy-name <policyname> | endpoint-ip <endpointip> color <colorid> | binding-sid <bsid> }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an SR-MPLS TE policy.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces.

Specifies the endpoint IP address of an SR-MPLS TE policy.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the color ID of an SR-MPLS TE policy.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.

Specifies the ID of a segment bound to an SR-MPLS TE policy.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
An LSP ping test instance monitors the connectivity of an SR-MPLS TE policy tunnel. You can perform the following operation as required:
To configure the name of an SR-MPLS TE policy for an NQA LSP test instance, run the policy policy-name command.To configure the ID of a segment bound to an SR-MPLS TE policy for an NQA LSP test instance, run the policy binding-sid command.To configure an endpoint IP address and color ID for an NQA LSP test instance, run the policy endpoint-ip color command.

Prerequisites
The lsp-type srte-policy command has been run.
